article.headline: American U. 69, UMBC 58
article.story: WASHINGTON -- Charles Hinkle scored 18 points and American University defeated winless Maryland-Baltimore County 69-58 on Thursday night for its sixth straight victory. The winning streak matched last season's longest for the Eagles. Hinkle, who hit 7 of 8 free throws, has scored double-digit points in every game this season. Troy Brewer added 15 points for American (6-2) and Tony Wroblicky posted a career-high 13 rebounds. The Retrievers (0-7) opened up a 28-22 lead, but the Eagles closed out the final 4:05 of the first half with a 15-4 run. After the break, American used an 8-2 spurt to push the lead into double figures and UMBC could get no closer than six the rest of the way. The Eagles made 20 of 32 free throws compared to 12 of 17 for the Retrievers. Chase Plummer had 18 points and nine rebounds for UMBC, which won the battle of the boards 41-36.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
